page.title: 08Older Generation Collingham
page.content: Many of the older residents of Collingham have witnessed its development over the past 40 years.One old lady has lived in Collingham for 89 years.Her earliest memories are of a little cottage at South End.She also remembers paddling in the stream, playing cricket,stilts,hopscotch, skipping,hoop and stick and the mouth organ.Also of boys playing whip and top,marbles and renting a bike.one of her earliest memories is of when she was 8,wearing a pink dress and watching the soldiers returning from the Boer War. Others talk of the times when the River Fleet flooded and villagers would skate on the ice.Many local fairs also came to the village. Although the memories linger on the older residents appreciate many of the facilities a developing village brings
